result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard M. De Santis

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Richard M. De Santis in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Richard M. De Santis.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt offers plea agreement on the record. State speaks to the court. Parties are in agreement. Atty Thomas-Schmidt offers a plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form. Court questions the defendant. State filed amended information. Court finds the defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. 



20CF87
Count 1-As amended defendant pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 2-Defendant pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Count 3-DRI
Count 4-DRI


22CF9
Count 1-DRI
Count 2-Defendant pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 3-Defendant pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 


Court orders a PSI-Bond to continue.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:01 PM Defendant Richard M. De Santis appeared by video from the Washburn County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Richard M. De Santis.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews court file. Court questions the defendant-no longer has PO Box number. Current address-N12787 Smith Bridge Rd. Minong, WI 54859.  State makes bond argument. Defendant has no ability to post cash. Argument from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Court sets bond.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:31 AM Defendant Richard M. De Santis not in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Richard M. De Santis.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. Atty Thomas-Schmidt has no information for the court. State requests body only warrant and requesting Jury Trial be removed. Court  makes ruling. Court authorizes Warrant and trial can be removed. Forfeiture proceedings to begin.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard M. De Santis
Current: PO Box 41, Minong, WI 54859   (Effective: 01-27-2022)
Prior: PO Box 41 321 5th Ave, Minong, WI 54859
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Richard M. De Santis not in court.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Defendant Richard M. De Santis. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Off record @ 10:07 AM for counsel to contact defendant. Back on record @ 10:15 AM. Court recalls case. Defendant appears via phone. Court speaks to the defendant re: his non-appearance. Court questions the def. re: his right to appear in person. Court finds the def. waives his right to appear in person. Court continues. Waived reading of the Information. Not guilty plea is entered. Counsel requests a Status. Bond to continue.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

02:31 PM Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Defendant Richard M. De Santis. Prosecuting Atty Sheila Yohnk appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard M. De Santis in court. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt updates address, waives further reading and waives preliminary hearing in 22CF9. The Court questions the DE. The Court finds that the DE knowingly and voluntarily waives his rights. Atty Yohnk requests bind over. DE is bound over for trial. Set for arraignment. Adjourned. 
Clarification on the record that DeSantis has no space. 
Address:N12783 Smith Bridge Rd, Minong WI 54859  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that serves or carries alcohol on the premises.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless it's prescribed by a licensed physician.

Attorney Sheila Yohnk appears for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian Ness appears by video for the defendant. Defendant Richard De Santis appears by video in custody. The Court calls case and appearances. The Court finds probable cause. The Court questions Atty Yohnk. The Court questions the DE. Atty Yohnk requests cash bond. Atty Ness argues bond. The Court orders $100 cash bond. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that serves or carries alcohol on the premises.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless it's prescribed by a licensed physician.
